revision.text:
{{Refimprove|date=December 2018}} {{Infobox Casino |casino=Downtown Grand Las Vegas |theme= |logo=Downtown_Grand_Las_Vegas.png |location=[[Las Vegas, Nevada]] |address=206 N 3rd Street |image=LADY_LUCK_CASINO.JPG |date_opened=1964 |date_closed= |rooms=629 |space_gaming={{convert|24085|sqft|abbr=on}} |shows= |notable_restaurants=Freedom Beat
Triple George Grill
Sidebar
[[Hogs and Heifers|Hogs and Heifers Saloon]] |owner=CIM Group |license_holder=Fifth Street Gaming |casino_type=Land-based |renovations= 2006–13 |names_pre= Lady Luck |website={{URL|downtowngrand.com}} }} The '''Downtown Grand Las Vegas''', formerly the '''Lady Luck Hotel & Casino''', is a [[hotel]] and [[casino]] in [[Downtown Las Vegas]], [[Nevada]], owned by the CIM Group and operated by Fifth Street Gaming. The Downtown Grand is the centerpiece of '''Downtown3rd''', a new neighborhood and entertainment district under development in downtown Las Vegas. ==Facility== Set on {{convert|6.27|acre}} at 3rd Street and East Ogden Avenue, the Downtown Grand has two hotel towers: to the east, the 18-story Casino Tower built in 1985 with 295 rooms, and to the west, the 25-story Grand Tower with 334 rooms. The East Tower is connected to the ground level casino. The property is served by a four-level parking garage and features several restaurants and entertainment venues along 3rd Street. These establishments include Freedom Beat, Triple George Grill, Sidebar, and [[Hogs and Heifers|Hogs and Heifers Saloon]]. ==History== ===Lady Luck (1964–2006)=== * In 2000 the Lady Luck was acquired by [[Isle of Capri Casinos]].{{cite web | url = http://gaming.unlv.edu/abstract/fin_isle.html | title = Isle of Capri Company Profile | author = UNLV | accessdate = December 1, 2018 }} * On June, 2002 it was purchased by Steadfast AMX who turned two floors into timeshares. * On May 13, 2005 it was purchased by the Henry Brent Company for $24 million.{{cite web | url = http://online.casinocity.com/news/news.cfm?ArticleId=59751 | title = CEO's NFL Ties Would Affect Wagers | author = UNLV | date = September 9, 2005 | accessdate = Dec 10, 2008 }} * On May 16, 2005 plans were announced for a major renovation and expansion of the property to begin early in 2006. ===Closing and renovations (2006–13)=== On February 11, 2006 the hotel and casino, but not the timeshares, closed for remodeling; the property was expected to be closed for nine to twelve months but financing collapsed. On June 12, 2007 the casino was purchased by the CIM Group for over $100 million.{{cite web | url = http://www.lasvegassun.com/news/2008/jul/02/city-mulls-downtown-land-sale-cut-rate/#axzz2WFufC6u1 | title = City mulls downtown land sale at cut rate | author = Las Vegas Sun | date = July 2, 2008 }} [[File:Lady Luck construction Oct 2012.jpg|thumbnail|left|Workers tearing down portions of the casino for renovation in October 2012.]]In July 2008 the city was investigating rezoning the nearby land containing the transit center to unrestricted gaming. With the transit center relocated, the land would be available for development.{{citation needed|date=December 2018}} Mayor [[Oscar Goodman]] applauded the attempt to re-invigorate the plans to renovate the Lady Luck: "For the past several years I have seen a rotting corpse. The Lady Luck structure has been a blight."{{cite news |last=Spillman |first=Benjamin |title=Land-value raise may lift Lady Luck |url=http://www.lvrj.com/business/22854419.html |work=Las Vegas Review-Journal |date=July 3, 2008 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080709081203/http://www.lvrj.com/business/22854419.html |archivedate=July 9, 2008}} As of July 2009, Goodman once again said in a council meeting that "The Lady Luck is a disaster," and then called the skeletal structure a "carcass". Las Vegas city leaders wanted CIM Group to raze the unfinished structure at Fourth Street and Stewart Avenue and do a better job of keeping sidewalks and landscaping clean near the site. CIM had until late December 2009 to begin a $100 million renovation of the Lady Luck; otherwise, it would potentially lose an offer from the city which would hand over land around the proposed nearby [[Mob Museum]].{{cite news |last=Spillman |first=Benjamin |title=Mayor calls Lady Luck casino 'carcass' |url=http://www.lvrj.com/business/49971782.html |work=Las Vegas Review-Journal |date=July 5, 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090708051927/http://www.lvrj.com/business/49971782.html |archivedate=July 8, 2009}} On July 23, 2009, some demolition work started on a 4-story concrete building adjacent to the main resort. This work was completed in accordance with the city's request for CIM Group to raze the condemned structure.{{cite news |title=Demolition begins at downtown's Lady Luck |url=http://www.lvrj.com/news/breaking_news/51507217.html |work=Las Vegas Review-Journal |date=July 23, 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090725221921/http://www.lvrj.com/news/breaking_news/51507217.html |archivedate=July 25, 2009}} On March 15, 2010, CIM Group made an agreement with city officials to have the renovations completed by December 31, 2011. There was the potential that the hotel/casino would reopen in 2012, five years after its originally scheduled reopening in 2007.{{cite web |last= |first= |title=Downtown hopes for upturn, New casino owners bring money, optimism to help area rebound |url=https://nl.newsbank.com |website=Las Vegas Business Press |accessdate=December 1, 2018 |date=March 30, 2010 |subscription=yes|via=NewsLibrary}} In October 2011, plans were announced to rename the '''Lady Luck''' to the '''Downtown Grand'''.{{citation needed|date=December 2018}} The property underwent a $100 million renovation.{{cite news |last=Sieroty |first=Chris |title=Las Vegas' Downtown Grand to hire 800 |url=https://www.reviewjournal.com/business/casinos-gaming/las-vegas-downtown-grand-to-hire-800/ |accessdate=December 1, 2018 |work=Las Vegas Review-Journal |date=May 20, 2013}} Construction of '''Downtown3rd''' on the former site of the Lady Luck began in the fall of 2011. The new Downtown Grand Hotel and Casino was scheduled to open in late 2013,{{Cite news|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2013/nov/12/business/la-fi-mo-lady-luck-renovation-20131112|title=Makeover of Lady Luck casino in downtown Las Vegas completed|last=Vincent|first=Roger|date=2013-11-12|work=Los Angeles Times|access-date=2018-11-30|language=en-US|issn=0458-3035}} and the remainder of Downtown3rd was expected to be completed in late 2014. ===Downtown Grand (2013–present)=== The new Downtown Grand opened on October 27, 2013.{{cite news|title=Downtown Las Vegas' newest resort opens|newspaper=Las Vegas Review-Journal|author=Chris Sieroty|date=October 27, 2013|url=http://www.reviewjournal.com/news/downtown-las-vegas-newest-resort-opens|accessdate=2013-10-28}} It is a [[boutique hotel]] and casino with {{convert|24085|sqft|abbr=on}} of casino space,{{cite web|url=http://gaming.nv.gov/modules/showdocument.aspx?documentid=3428|title=Listing of Financial Statements Square Footage (2017 data)|date=March 6, 2018|publisher=[[Nevada Gaming Control Board]]|accessdate=December 1, 2018|page=4}} 629 newly remodeled hotel rooms, 9 bars & restaurants and a 35,000 square foot urban rooftop pool retreat called Citrus.{{Cite news|url=https://www.downtowngrand.com/pool/|title=Las Vegas Rooftop Pool & Pool Deck: Downtown Grand Hotel|date=2015-04-08|work=Downtown Grand|access-date=2018-11-30|language=en-US}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * {{official website|http://www.downtowngrand.com/|Downtown Grand Las Vegas}} {{coord|36.1719|-115.1418|type:landmark|display=t}} {{Las Vegas casinos}} {{Las Vegas hotels}} {{Las Vegas skyscrapers}} {{Downtown Las Vegas}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Downtown Grand}} [[Category:Casinos in the Las Vegas Valley]] [[Category:Downtown Las Vegas]] [[Category:Skyscraper hotels in Las Vegas]] [[Category:Hotel buildings completed in 1964]] [[Category:Casino hotels]] [[Category:1964 establishments in Nevada]]

page.title: Durban Industry Climate Change Partnership Project

revision.text:
{{Multiple issues| {{self-published|date=December 2009}} {{refimprove|date=December 2009}} {{notability|Organizations|date=December 2009}} }}
[[File:DICCPP Logo.png|right|thumb|220px]] '''Durban Industry Climate Change Partnership Project''' (DICCPP) is a project aimed at facilitating industry response to climate change in the [[eThekwini Metropolitan Municipality|eThekwini]] Municipality ([[Durban]]), [[South Africa]][http://www.durban.gov.za/durban/government/energy/climate]. The project is being implemented through a partnership between the [[United Nations Industrial Development Organization]] (UNIDO), the Durban Investment Promotion Agency (DIPA),<ref name="DIPA">Durban Investment Promotion Agency, http://www.dipa.co.za/</ref> the eThekwini Municipality and the Durban Chamber of Commerce and Industry (DCCI).<ref name="DCCI">Durban Chamber of Commerce and Industry, http://www.durbanchamber.co.za/</ref>
The purpose of the project is to sensitise industry in Durban to the risks and opportunities associated with [[climate change]] by creating a platform through which learning and communication between industry and government can take place.<ref name="UNIDO">Unido South Africa, UNIDO Website, http://www.unido.org/index.php?id=1000128</ref> The project aims to establish a sustained partnership between the various industries organisations in Durban and the eThekwini Municipality. The partnership is seen as fundamental to responding to climate change and effectively contributing towards climate change mitigation and adaptation within the Durban metropolitan area.<ref name="Durban Portal">Climate Change, Durban Portal Website, http://durbanportal.net/ClimateChange/default.aspx</ref>
==Core areas== The partnership covers three core areas. These are: industry specific interventions; institutional support and; outreach.<ref name="Durban Portal" /> Specific actions within these core areas assist the partnership in fulfilling its assigned purpose.
===Industry specific interventions=== As part of the first core area, industry specific interventions, engagement with three main existing structures within Durban's industries is seen as critical to the success of the project. These existing industry structures or groupings are: the Durban Automotive Cluster; the Durban Chemical Cluster (DCC) and; the eThekwini Maritime and Logistics Cluster (EMLC).<ref name="Durban Portal" />
These industries are brought together and a process of learning, through the conducting of a number of forums by the DICCPP is realised. These forums<ref name="DAC">Durban Automotive Cluster Website, http://www.dbnautocluster.org.za/dac/index/news/id/41</ref> designed specifically for the local industry cover issues such as [[greenhouse gas]] (GHG) assessments (which include carbon footprint calculations, life cycle and supply chain analysis and emission target development); financial implications or opportunities (which include information on carbon taxes, the carbon market, funding streams and investment opportunities); new technologies in renewable energy; waste management and finally; climate change response strategies.,<ref name="Durban Portal" /><ref name="DCC">Durban Chemical Cluster Website, http://www.durbanchemicalscluster.org.za/dcc/tmp/DCC%20Newsletter%20(November%202009).pdf</ref>
===Institutional support=== The second core area of the DICCPP is providing an institutional support mechanism for actively driving and monitoring industry climate change response activities in Durban. In this regard, the DICCPP is working closely with the eThekwini Energy Office to develop a climate change mitigation competency in the municipal structure.<ref name="Durban Energy Office">Durban Energy Office, http://www.durban.gov.za/durban/government/energy/saving</ref>
===Outreach=== The third core area of the DICCPP is called outreach and this is seen as an important part of the project in that it seeks to creates an awareness about climate change issues.<ref name="Durban Portal" /> A 'carbon footprint video' is being developed within the eThekwini communications department and serves to assist industry to quantify their [[carbon footprint]]. The DICCPP is also working with the Imagine Durban team running an Electricity Saving Competition within business in the city.<ref name="Imagine Durban">Imagine Durban, http://www.imaginedurban.org/index.php/BusinessElectricity.html</ref>
==Strategy== The project's ultimate strategy is to establish a forum for industry to meet regularly to discuss climate change mitigation and adaptation activities.<ref name="UNIDO" /> In doing so, this will facilitate investment and technology transfer between Durban and a similar project in China (also implemented by UNIDO).<ref name="UNIDO" /> Once this has been established, it is envisaged that regular meetings with the government and other stakeholders will take place.
==See also== *[[South African Education and Environment Project]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [http://durbanportal.net/ClimateChange/Project%20Documents/About.aspx/ Durban Portal]
[[Category:Climate change organizations]] [[Category:Business organisations based in South Africa]] [[Category:Environment of South Africa]]

{{Infobox automobile | name = Multix | caption = |image = [[File:Multix_Logo.jpg|200px]] |website = {{URL|http://www.multix.in/}} | type = [[Personal utility vehicle]] | manufacturer = [[Eicher Motors]]
& Polaris India | aka = | production = August 2015 – March 2018 | model_years = 2015-2018 | assembly = [[Kukas]], [[Rajasthan]], India | designer = [[Polaris Industries]] | class = [[Personal utility vehicle]] | body_style = 4-door | layout = [[Front-engine, rear-wheel-drive layout]] | platform = | related = | engine = {{convert|31.18|cuin|0|abbr=on|order=flip}} {{unbulleted list | Greaves four-stroke [[Single-cylinder engine|single-cylinder]] [[BS III]] (diesel) }} | transmission = [[Manual transmission|Manual]] | propulsion = | wheelbase = {{convert|78.94|in|mm|0|abbr=on|order=flip}} | length = {{convert|127.36|in|mm|0|abbr=on|order=flip}} | width = {{convert|62.40|in|mm|0|abbr=on|order=flip}} | height = {{convert|73.07|in|mm|0|abbr=on|order=flip}} | weight = 650 & 750 kg | predecessor = | successor = | sp = us }} The '''Eicher Polaris Multix''' (or '''Multix''') was a [[personal utility vehicle]] manufactured by [[Eicher Motors]] and Polaris India (the Indian arm of [[Polaris Industries]]). The vehicle was announced in June 2015, and the first vehicle was delivered on 26 August 2015. Multix is promoted by its manufacturer as "India's first personal utility vehicle", able to be used as a [[people carrier]], a [[Commercial vehicle|cargo carrier]] and also a [[power generators|power generator]].{{cite news|title=Multix personal utility vehicle launched|work=[[The Hindu]]|last=Balachandar|first=G.|accessdate=8 October 2015|url=http://www.thehindu.com/news/cities/Coimbatore/multix-personal-utility-vehicle-launched/article7520477.ece}}{{cite news|title=Multix model comparisons|publisher=carewale.com|accessdate=8 October 2015|url=http://www.carwale.com/comparecars/eicherpolaris-multix-vs-eicherpolaris-multix/?car1=4113&car2=4112}}{{cite news|title=About Multix|publisher=Official website|accessdate=8 October 2015|url=http://www.multix.in/aboutus1.html#eicher1}} ==History== In July 2012, [[Eicher Motors]] and [[Polaris Industries]] formed a 50:50 [[joint venture]] (JV) to manufacture vehicles in [[India]].{{cite news|title=Eicher-Polaris start delivery of Multix|publisher=[[The Economic Times]]|accessdate=8 October 2015|url=http://auto.economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/passenger-vehicle/uv/eicher-polaris-starts-delivery-of-multix-gets-its-first-owner/48691388}} This [[Joint venture|JV]] was formed with an initial investment of {{INRConvert|350|c|1|no|to=USD|year=2012}} and the new company was named "Eicher Polaris Pvt. Ltd." Thereafter, [[Eicher Motors]] and [[Polaris Industries]] combined their [[research and development]] facilities in their new [[manufacturing plant]] in [[Kukas]], [[Jaipur]], [[Rajasthan]], India. In May 2018, Eicher and Polaris announced they were closing down the Indian-joint venture, and discontinuing the Multix.https://auto.ndtv.com/news/eicher-motors-closes-down-jv-with-polaris-multix-to-be-discontinued-1822655 ==Design== The Multix was designed with the aim of being used for both family and business purposes, and has been called a "3-in-1" vehicle.{{cite news|title=Eicher Polaris launches Multix, first Personal Vehicle in India|url=http://www.oncars.in/car-news/eicher-polaris-launches-multix-first-personal-vehicle-in-india/8098|accessdate=8 October 2015|work=On Cars India|date=2 October 2015}} Its cargo capacity is 400 litres. Multix also generates 3 [[kilowatts]] of [[electricity]] and can thus be used as a [[power generators|power generator]] as well. ===Variants=== The Multix has two variants, the AX+ and the MX. With the exception of doors (and the overall weight of the vehicle), both the variants are identical. AX+ has open doorways, whilst MX has doors. The [[curb weight]] of the MX is 100 kg more than that of AX+.{{cite news|title=Specification: AX+|publisher=Official website|accessdate=8 October 2015|url=http://www.multix.in/AX1.html}}{{cite news|title=Specification: MX|publisher=Official website|accessdate=8 October 2015|url=http://www.multix.in/MX.html}} ==Availability== As of October 2015, 30 JV dealerships had been set up to sell Multix models, in [[Andhra Pradesh]], [[Bihar]], [[Gujarat]], [[Maharashtra]], [[Rajasthan]], [[Tamil Nadu]] and [[Uttar Pradesh]].{{cite news|last1=Gopalan|first1=Murali|title=It's one step at a time for Multix|url=http://www.thehindubusinessline.com/specials/auto-focus/its-one-step-at-a-time-for-multix/article7712620.ece|accessdate=8 October 2015|work=[[The Hindu]] Business Line|date=1 October 2015}} Eicher Polaris Pvt. Ltd plans to have dealerships throughout India by mid-2017. Four colors were available as of June 2015. The first Multix vehicle was sold in August 2015, to [[Ganesh Narayan Choudhary]]. The company expects to sell 60,000 vehicles per year. ===Financing=== Eicher Polaris Pvt. Ltd has contracted with Cholamandalam Investment, and as of August 2015 was in negotiations with a number of other financial institutions, to provide financing to customers wanting to buy a Multix AX+ or MX.{{cite news|title=Eicher-Polaris JV|work=[[The Hindu]]|last=Balachandar|first=G.|accessdate=8 October 2015|url=http://www.thehindu.com/business/eicher-polaris-jv-in-talks-to-tie-up-financing-for-multix/article7512934.ece}} ==Reception== As a new entrant in the Indian automotive market, the Eicher Motors-Polaris India partnership is expected to face challenges in establishing its brand. G. Balachandar of ''[[The Hindu]]'' referred to the Multix as able to convert from "a small car with space for family of 5 [to] a small truck with storage space" and said the innovative vehicle would "create its own segment of buyers." Another article in ''The Hindu''{{'}}s "Business Line" praised the Multix's "smooth ride" and ability to "handl[e] rough terrain", and suggested it could "replace other mobility options" such as trucks, tractors and traditional automobiles. Santanu Choudhury, blogging for ''[[The Wall Street Journal]]'', noted that the Multix was both small enough to give buyers the maneuverability needed for narrow or congested streets, and equipped to handle adverse road conditions including severe ruts and minor flooding.{{cite news|last1=Choudhury|first1=Santanu|title=Meet the Multix, India's Newest Pickup Truck With Extra Charge|url=https://blogs.wsj.com/indiarealtime/2015/06/22/meet-the-multix-indias-newest-pickup-truck-with-extra-charge/|accessdate=8 October 2015|publisher=''[[The Wall Street Journal]]'' (blog)|date=22 June 2015}} He also praised the possibilities opened up by the Multix's power generation capability, suggesting it could be used "to light up homes, power tools or even run a DJ console." ==Specifications== ''Multix AX+'' *Seating capacity: 5 (including driver) *Displacement: 511 cm3 *Max Engine power: 9.78 [[Horsepower#Brake horsepower (bhp)|Bhp]] *Max Torque: 27.1 [[Newton metre|Nm]] @ 1,400 [[Revolutions per minute|rpm]] *Wheel base: 2,005 [[Millimetre|mm]] *Length: 3,235 mm *Width: 1,585 mm *Height: 1,856 mm *Curb weight: 650 kg *Engine: Greaves four-stroke [[Single-cylinder engine|single-cylinder]] [[BS III]]{{cite news|last1=Shenoy|first1=Arun|title=Eicher Polaris Pvt Ltd launches Multix, a 'Personal Utility Vehicle' for Rs. 2.32 Lakhs|url=http://www.cardekho.com/india-car-news/eicher-polaris-pvt-ltd-launches-multix-a-personal-utility-vehicle-for-rs-232-lakhs-16079.htm|accessdate=8 October 2015|work=CarDekho.com|date=18 June 2015}} *Fuel: [[Diesel fuel|Diesel]] *Ground clearance: 225 mm *Cargo capacity: 1,918 liters *Transmission: four-speed manual ==See also== *[[Eicher Motors]] *[[Polaris Industries]] ==External links== * [http://www.multix.in/ Official page] {{Portal bar|India|Cars}} == References == {{Reflist|colwidth=30em}} {{Cars in India}} [[Category:Minivans]] [[Category:Cars of India]] [[Category:Joint ventures]]

{{Expand French|Guy Degrenne|date=January 2012}} '''Guy Degrenne''' (August 3, 1925 in Tinchebray (Orne) – November 7, 2006) was a French businessman who specialised in [[cutlery]] and [[Household silver|silver]]ware. He has founded the Guy Degrenne group, since 1987 a subsidiary of holding 'Table de France'.<ref>From {{cite journal|title=La nouvelle stratégie de Guy Degrenne, marque symbole|journal=Entreprendre|date=8 April 2015|url=http://www.entreprendre.fr/la-nouvelle--strategie-de-guy-degrenne-marque-symbole|accessdate=14 April 2016}}.</ref>
==Biography== Guy Degrenne attended college St Joseph in [[Caen]], then studied at [[ESSEC Business School]], and took up his father's steel factory (at [[Sourdeval]]) in 1948.
Guy Degrenne first has war-left steel parts collected, and turns them in [[stainless steel]] dishes, with instant commercial success. By 1958, Guy Degrenne sets up a tableware business, then by 1963 ushers in the luxury tableware business, in copying the standards of Parisian goldsmiths.
In 1967, part of the production is moved to a new factory in [[Vire]] (Calvados). His business then employs about 600 workers. In 1978, Degrenne meets national recognition with [http://www.dailymotion.com/video/xa0v2k_guy-degrenne-1986_shortfilms a popular advert] reminiscent of his school years : a headmaster catches young Degrenne drawing dishes in his notebooks margin, and then warns him against ill-success (''Ce n'est pas comme cela que vous réussirez dans la vie'').

{{Use Singapore English|date=June 2017}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2017}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Inderjit Singh | native_name = | image = [http://www.ntu.edu.sg/AboutNTU/PublishingImages/Inderjit-Singh_b.jpg] | caption = | birth_name = Inderjit Singh Dhaliwal | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1960|6|6}} | birth_place = [[Punjab, India]] | nationality = Singaporean | constituency_MP4 = [[Ang Mo Kio Group Representation Constituency|Ang Mo Kio GRC]] | parliament4 = Singapore | term_start4 = 1996 | term_end4 = 2015 | predecessor4 = [[Umar Abdul Hamid]] | successor4 = [[Kwek Hian Chuan Henry]] | party = [[People's Action Party]] | alma_mater = [[University of Strathclyde]]
[[Nanyang Technological University]] | profession = [[engineer]] | religion = | website = }} '''Inderjit Singh Dhaliwal''' (born 5 June 1960) is a serial [[entrepreneur]][http://www.asiaone.com/Business/SME%2BCentral/Talking%2Bpoint/Story/A1Story20091119-181040.html Singapore as a hub for entrepreneurs] New Straits Times - 21 November 2009 and former politician in [[Parliament of Singapore|Singapore's parliament]] representing the [[Ang Mo Kio Group Representation Constituency|Ang Mo Kio GRC]] from 1996 to 2015.[http://www.parliament.gov.sg/AboutUs/Org-MP-MP-Prof-InderjitSingh.htm Curriculm Vitae] - [[Parliament of Singapore]] == Early life == Born in [[Punjab, India]], he came to Singapore when he was 10 months old, Singh attended Kaki Bukit Primary School in Singapore and then progressed to [[Broadrick Secondary School]] and [[Temasek Junior College]]. He began his university education with a [[Bachelor of Engineering]] from [[Nanyang Technological University]] (NTU) in [[Electrical and Electronics]]. He graduated with honors from the institution in 1985. While at [[Nanyang Technological University|Nanyang Tech]] he founded the EEE Club and was the first chairman of the NTU Students' Union Council. He also helped start the NTI Alumni Association (later became NTUAC). After earning his bachelors, he continued his [[education]] at the [[University of Strathclyde]] in [[Scotland]], earning an [[MBA]] in 1991.[http://www3.ntu.edu.sg/NanyangAlumniAwards/winners/mrinderjitsingh.htm Nanyang Alumni Achievement Award Recipient (2006)] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100301053840/http://www2.ntu.edu.sg/NanyangAlumniAwards/Winners/MrInderjitSingh.htm |date=1 March 2010 }} [[Nanyang Technological Institute]] == Corporate life == He began his career with [[Texas Instruments]], beginning as an [[engineer]] in 1985 and spent 13 years ascending the corporate ladder before becoming [[Chief operating officer|Director of Operations]] of the Singapore plant from 1996 to 1998.[http://www.sst.edu.sg/template02.dwt.php?page=52#J22 SST / Innovation & Entrepreneurship / COUNCIL MEMBERS] - [[School of Science and Technology, Singapore]] After his stint with Texas Instruments, Singh began a career of [[entrepreneurship]], in which he started six businesses[http://www.asiaone.com/Business/SME%2BCentral/Prime%2BMovers/Story/A1Story20070625-15396.html Marathon man of SMEs] New Straits Times - 25 May 2007 after leaving the corporate arena.[http://www.atimes.com/atimes/Southeast_Asia/DK27Ae02.html Singapore embarks on entrepreneurship] Asia Times Online - 27 November 2002 He founded the United Test and Assembly Center (UTAC), a semiconductor firm, in 1998 which became a Unicorn valued at US$2b in 2001. The venture was mostly funded by [[Taiwan]]ese friends of his due to what he terms "a dearth of willing investors and a general disbelief that he would be able to achieve his dream of creating a homegrown multinational firm.".[http://business.asiaone.com/print/Business/SME%2BCentral/Prime%2BMovers/Story/A1Story20070519-3337.html New entrepreneurship landscape ] The Business Times - 19 September 2006 . He raised a record of US$138m, all at one go, at the seeds stage in 1998. Inderjit left UTAC in 2001. The firm was listed on the [[Singapore Stock Exchange]] in 2004. Around the same time he started UTAC, he started, Tri-Star, which he started with his brothers as trading and services firm, in which much of his and his family's savings were used to fund the company. Today Tri Star is present in 38 countries in Africa as a distributor of Consumer Electronic products. Inderjit subsequently also set-up semiconductor engineering firm Infiniti Solutions in 2001. Infiniti at its peak had operations in the Silicon Valley, USA, in Austin Texas, a factory in Philippines and with the HQ in Singapore. More recently, he founded Solstar International, a Singapore-based consumer electronics products company, of which he is currently the CEO. Solstar is a Singapore based Consumer Electronics brand selling in 25 countries in Africa and other developing countries around Asia. In 2009, Inderjit, helped start Urah Transdermal,a Singapore based Life-Science Research and product Company that has Developed and patented technologies for the delivery of active molecules through the skin barriers to biological targets. He is a Co-President of the World Entrepreneurship Forum, a global organisation on entrepreneurship development. He has also been actively driving the transformation of the entrepreneurship landscape and helping to shape policies to better support start-ups, small and medium businesses in Singapore and has been a board member of Spring Singapore (Enterprise Singapore today) and Vice-Chairman of the Action Community for Entrepreneurship (ACE). He was also a board member of the Urban Redevelopment Authority (URA) for 8 years where he also Chaired the Audit committee of URA. Inderjit is currently a member of the Board of Trustees of the Nanyang Technological University (NTU) and also is the Chairman of the board of NTUitive, the Innovation company of NTU. He is also the Chairman of the Alumni and Development committee, a board committee of NTU. He is also a member of the International Advisory Panel of EMLyon, a premier business school in France. He is the author of the popular book, “The Art and Science of Entrepreneurship”, which captures his entrepreneurial experiences. He received the Nanyang Distinguished Alumni award in 2011 from NTU and was awarded the Public Service Medal (Pingat Bakti Masyarakat) in 2016 by the government of Singapore as part of its annual National Day awards. He received the Strathclyde Alumni Distinguished Entrepreneur Award in 2013 [https://www.strath.ac.uk/sen/celebratingsuccess/sade/mrinderjitsingh/] == Political Life == He became an active grassroots leader in 1984. He became a Member of Parliament for the [[Kebun Bahru|Kebun Baru]] ward in the Ang Mo Kio GRC, in the Prime Minister's team, since the 1996 General Elections, and stepped down in 2015. As a Member of Parliament Inderjit held various positions. He was a Deputy Government Whip for a number of years and also the Chairman of the Government Parliamentary Committee of the Ministries of Finance and Trade and Industry. == References == {{Reflist|2}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Singh, Inderjit}} [[Category:1960 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People's Action Party politicians]] [[Category:Singaporean politicians of Indian descent]] [[Category:Singaporean Sikhs]] [[Category:Singaporean businesspeople]] [[Category:Singaporean engineers]] [[Category:Members of the Parliament of Singapore]] [[Category:Singaporean people of Indian Punjabi descent]] [[Category:Temasek Junior College alumni]] [[Category:Nanyang Technological University alumni]] [[Category:Punjabi people]] [[Category:People from Punjab, India]] [[Category:Alumni of the University of Strathclyde]] [[Category:Singaporean politicians of Punjabi descent]] [[Category:Chief operating officers]] [[Category:Indian emigrants to Singapore]] [[Category:Naturalised citizens of Singapore]]

The '''International Annealed Copper Standard''' ('''IACS''') is a [[Standard (metrology)|standard]] established in 1914 by the United States Department of Commerce.<ref>{{cite techreport |series=Circular of the Bureau of Standards No.31 |title=Copper Wire Tables, |date=October 1, 1914 |edition=3d |publisher=United States Department of Commerce |url=https://archive.org/details/copperwiretables31unituoft}}</ref> It is an empirically derived standard value for the [[electrical conductivity]] of commercially available [[copper]].
Sometime around 1913 several copper samples from 14 important refiners and wire manufacturers were analyzed by the [[U.S. Bureau of Standards]]. The average [[Electrical resistance|resistance]] of the samples was determined to be 0.15292 [[Ohm|Ω]] for copper wires with a mass of 1 [[gram]] of uniform [[Cross section (geometry)|cross section]] and 1 [[meter]] in length at 20 °C. In the United States this is usually written as "0.15292 ohm (meter, gram) at 20 °C".
Germany proposed a slight modification of this value to "0.15328 ohm (meter, gram) at 20 °C", this being equivalent to a conductivity of exactly {{val|58|e=6|u=[[Siemens (unit)|S]]|up=m}} at 20 °C. The German modification was adopted by the [[International Electrotechnical Commission]] in 1913 and subsequently published by the [[United States Department of Commerce]] on October 1, 1914 as the International Annealed Copper Standard (IACS).
The standard is most often used as a comparative property in the specification of the conductivity of other metals. For example, the conductivity of a particular grade of [[titanium]] may be specified as 1.2 % IACS, meaning that its electrical conductivity is 1.2 % of the copper specified as the IACS standard.<ref> {{ cite web | title = Resistivity and Conductivity Units Converter | url=http://www.zappitec.com/en/calculator/ }} </ref>
The standard can be found at https://archive.org/stream/copperwiretables31unituoft#page/n0/mode/1up.
== Quality of aluminum alloys ==
[[Heat treatment]] will alter several properties of an alloy, many of which are important to a design engineer. A measurement of the electric conductivity of [[aluminum alloys]] can be used to verify that a heat treatment process has been done correctly. For example a component made of "7075" alloy which was correctly treated with the process "T73" to gain resistance to [[stress corrosion cracking]] will fall in the range of 38.0 to 43.0 % IACS.<ref> {{cite web | title = Stress Corrosion Cracking of Aluminum Alloys | last = | first = | date = June 2001 | website = Total Materia | publisher = | url = http://www.totalmateria.com/Article17.htm | access-date = 14 April 2016 }} </ref>
The acceptance criteria for electrical conductivity of finished or semi-finished parts of wrought aluminum alloys are contained in [[SAE International]] specification AMS2658 Hardness and Conductivity Inspection of Wrought Aluminum Alloy Parts. Here the values are given in reference to the IACS.
A method for measuring electrical conductivity is described in [[ASTM International]] specification ASTM E 1004 Electromagnetic (Eddy-Current) Measurements of Electrical Conductivity. Electrical conductivity meters with direct readout in %IACS are commercially available<ref>{{cite web | title = Eddy Current Conductivity Meter for Metals | last = | first = | date = | website = Zappitec | publisher = | url = http://www.zappitec.com/en/products | access-date = 26 September 2018 }}</ref>.

<!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:Jose carlos semenzato.jpg|thumb|230px|{{deletable image-caption}} .|right]] --> {{Infobox person | name = José Carlos Semenzato | image = José Carlos Semenzato.jpg | caption = Semenzato | birth_date = {{birth year and age|1968}} | birth_place = [[Cafelândia, São Paulo|Cafelândia]], [[São Paulo (state)|São Paulo]], {{BRA}} | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = [[Brazilian people|Brazilian]] | alma_mater = | occupation = [[Entrepreneur]] | parents = | spouse = | children = | religion = | known_for = Founder of Microlins Language Schools and the multisetorial franchise holding SMZTO | website = }}
'''José Carlos Semenzato'''(born in [[Cafelândia (São Paulo)|Cafelândia]], [[São Paulo]], in 23rd, March 1968) is a Brazilian entrepreneur. He is the current president of '''[https://www.smzto.com.br/ SMZTO Holding de Franquias Setoriais]''', a franchise holding that he founded in 2010 and has ten affiliated companies: [[Casa X]], [https://www.unitedidiomas.com/ United Idiomas], [https://www.partmedsaude.com.br/ PartMed], [http://www.odontocompany.com/ OdontoCompany], [https://www.lentrecotedeparis.com.br/ L’Entrecôte de Paris], [https://www.espacolaser.com.br/ Espaçolaser], [http://www.joyjuice.com.br/ Joy Juice], [https://www.smzto.com.br/ Casa X], [Embelleze|Instituto Embelleze] and [https://www.guacamolecompany.com.br/ Gua.Co].
== Biography == Son of a bricklayer and a housewife, '''Semenzato''' started working at the age of 13. At the time, he sold, in the suburb of [[Lins, São Paulo|Lins]] (a city in the hinterland of the state of São Paulo), snacks produced by his mother. At 16 years old, he became a manager in a copy company. After this experience, he worked in a construction company learning how to program computers. At 18, he started teaching computing to high school students at '''Instituto Americano de Lins'''. At 23 years old, '''Semenzato''' founded his own computing school: [[Microlins]].
In ''1994'', he owned 17 '''Microlins''' schools and, after that, he decided to start expanding through franchising.
In ''2010'', Microlins had 700 schools in 500 Brazilian cities and was sold to [[Grupo Multi Holding|Grupo Multi]] in a transaction of R$ 110 million.
In ''2012'', '''Semenzato''' partned with the Brazilian TV host [[Xuxa|Xuxa Meneghel]] to found [[Casa X]], a franchise company for parties and social events. In 2015, the entrepreneur and Meneghel became partners in Espaçolaser, a franchise company specialized in laser hair removal. LifeUSA, an English school franchise, was founded in 2016 in partnership with the Brazilian tennis player [[Gustavo Kuerten]]. <ref>{{cite web|url=https://endeavor.org.br/autor/jose-carlos-semenzato/|title=José Carlos Semenzato|website=Endeavor|accessdate=28 December 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171228145946/https://endeavor.org.br/autor/jose-carlos-semenzato/|archivedate=28 December 2017|df=}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=https://endeavor.org.br/um-realizador-serial-day1-jose-carlos-semenzato/|title=Um realizador “serial” – Day1 de José Carlos Semenzato - Endeavor Brasil|website=endeavor.org.br|accessdate=28 December 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171228145946/https://endeavor.org.br/um-realizador-serial-day1-jose-carlos-semenzato/|archivedate=28 December 2017|df=}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.abf.com.br/jose-carlos-semenzato/|title=José Carlos Semenzato|date=26 November 2008|website=abf.com.br|accessdate=28 December 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171228145946/https://www.abf.com.br/jose-carlos-semenzato/|archivedate=28 December 2017|df=}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://revistapegn.globo.com/Revista/Common/0,,EMI108558-17152,00.html|title=PEGN - NOTÍCIAS - A trajetória de José Carlos Semenzato, da Microlins|website=revistapegn.globo.com|accessdate=28 December 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170328180147/http://revistapegn.globo.com/Revista/Common/0,,EMI108558-17152,00.html|archivedate=28 March 2017|df=}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mapadasfranquias.com.br/noticia/jose-carlos-semenzato-conheca-a-trajetoria-do-fundador-da-maior-aceleradora-de-franquias-do-brasil|title=José Carlos Semenzato: conheça a trajetória do fundador da maior aceleradora de franquias do Brasil|website=mapadasfranquias.com.br|accessdate=28 December 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171228145946/http://www.mapadasfranquias.com.br/noticia/jose-carlos-semenzato-conheca-a-trajetoria-do-fundador-da-maior-aceleradora-de-franquias-do-brasil|archivedate=28 December 2017|df=}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.istoedinheiro.com.br/tag/jose-carlos-semenzato/|title=José Carlos Semenzato - ISTOÉ DINHEIRO|website=ISTOÉ DINHEIRO|accessdate=28 December 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171228145947/https://www.istoedinheiro.com.br/tag/jose-carlos-semenzato/|archivedate=28 December 2017|df=}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.riopreto.sp.leg.br/noticias/sessao-solene|title=José Carlos Semenzato recebe título de cidadão rio-pretense — Câmara Municipal de São José do Rio Preto - SP|website=Câmara Municipal de São José do Rio Preto - SP|accessdate=28 December 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171228000009/http://www.riopreto.sp.leg.br/noticias/sessao-solene|archivedate=28 December 2017|df=}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.correiobraziliense.com.br/app/noticia/eu-estudante/tf_carreira/2017/03/19/tf_carreira_interna,581932/um-empresario-de-coragem.shtml|title=Um empresário de coragem|first=|last=Eu,Estudante|website=correiobraziliense.com.br|accessdate=28 December 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170606190858/http://www.correiobraziliense.com.br/app/noticia/eu-estudante/tf_carreira/2017/03/19/tf_carreira_interna,581932/um-empresario-de-coragem.shtml|archivedate=6 June 2017|df=}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://diretodemiami.ig.com.br/index.php/2012/07/24/gigante-da-franquia-brasileira-investe-no-seu-primeiro-negocio-no-exterior/comment-page-2/|title=iG Colunistas – Direto de Miami: Histórias de Vida e Dicas do Melhor de Miami – iG » Gigante da franquia brasileira investe no seu primeiro negócio no exterior.|website=diretodemiami.ig.com.br|accessdate=28 December 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140418062134/http://diretodemiami.ig.com.br/index.php/2012/07/24/gigante-da-franquia-brasileira-investe-no-seu-primeiro-negocio-no-exterior/comment-page-2/|archivedate=18 April 2014|df=}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www1.folha.uol.com.br/fsp/mercado/me1406201008.htm|title=Folha de S.Paulo - Controlador da Wizard compra a Microlins - 14/06/2010|website=www1.folha.uol.com.br|accessdate=28 December 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171228145947/http://www1.folha.uol.com.br/fsp/mercado/me1406201008.htm|archivedate=28 December 2017|df=}}</ref>

[[Kyle Kulinski]]
Saikat Chakrabarti
[[Zack Exley]] |key_people = Saikat Chakrabarti
[[Zack Exley]]
Tara Reilley{{cite web|url= http://docquery.fec.gov/cgi-bin/forms/C00630665/1195264/ |title= FILING FEC-1195264 |date=December 22, 2017 |accessdate=December 24, 2017 |work=Justice Democrats |publisher=Federal Election Commission }}
Alexandra Rojas |type = [[Political action committee]] |registration_id = C00630665 |headquarters =
[[Knoxville]], [[Tennessee]] |revenue = $923,803.95 |revenue_year = 2017 |disbursements = $499,634.87 |website = {{URL|https://justicedemocrats.com}} |affiliations = [[Brand New Congress]]
[[National Nurses United]]
''Former affiliation:
''[[The Young Turks]]'' }} '''Justice Democrats''' is an American [[Progressivism in the United States|progressive]] [[political action committee]]{{cite web|title=Justice Democrats - committee overview|url=https://www.fec.gov/data/committee/C00630665/|website=Campaign Finance Data|publisher=[[Federal Election Commission]]}}{{cite web|url=https://justicedemocrats.com/FAQ#q3_1 |title= Justice Democrats: Frequently Asked Questions |publisher=Justice Democrats |access-date=September 26, 2017}} founded on January 23, 2017 by [[Cenk Uygur]] of ''[[The Young Turks]]'', [[Kyle Kulinski]] of ''Secular Talk'', and former leadership from the [[Bernie Sanders presidential campaign, 2016|2016 Bernie Sanders presidential campaign]]. Uygur and Kulinski are no longer affiliated with the group. The organization formed as a result of the [[2016 United States presidential election]] and has a stated goal of reforming the [[Democratic party (United States)|Democratic Party]] by running "a unified campaign to replace every corporate-backed member of [[United States Congress|Congress]] and rebuild the Democratic Party from scratch" starting in the [[United States elections, 2018|2018 congressional midterm elections]].{{Cite web |url=https://justicedemocrats.com/platform/ |title=Platform |publisher=Justice Democrats |access-date=January 25, 2017 }}{{Cite news|url=https://mic.com/articles/166390/cenk-ugyur-bernie-sanders-staffers-team-up-to-take-over-the-democratic-party|title=Cenk Uygur, Bernie Sanders staffers team up to take over the Democratic Party|last=McKay|first=Tom|date=January 23, 2017|newspaper=Mic|access-date=January 27, 2017}} Justice Democrats describes its views as being held by most Americans, but deemed "politically impossible" by the current political establishment because of systemic [[political corruption]].{{cite web|url=http://billmoyers.com/story/progressives-new-silent-majority/|title=Progressives Are the New Silent Majority – BillMoyers.com|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=http://www.alternet.org/election-2016/5-radical-bernie-sanders-ideas-many-americans-strongly-support|title=5 'Radical' Bernie Sanders Ideas Many Americans Strongly Support|first=Sophia|last=Tesfaye|date=5 July 2015|publisher=|via=AlterNet}} They comment that as all campaigns need donations and that candidates who hold policies viewed as unfavorable by corporate interests and wealthy individuals will be denied funding by corporations. Therefore the system actually ends up forcing politicians to change their policies to suit the current business environment.{{cite web|url=https://theintercept.com/2015/07/30/politicians-admitting-obvious-fact-money-affects-vote/|title="Yes, We're Corrupt": A List of Politicians Admitting That Money Controls Politics|first=Jon SchwarzJon|last=Schwarz2015-07-30T16:23:50+00:00|website=The Intercept}}{{cite web|url=https://represent.us/action/theproblem-3/|title=One graph shows how the rich control American politics|publisher=}} In the 2018 election, 26 of the 79 candidates endorsed by Justice Democrats won their respective primary elections. Seven of these candidates won in the general election: [[Raúl Grijalva]], [[Ro Khanna]], [[Ayanna Pressley]], [[Rashida Tlaib]], [[Ilhan Omar]], [[Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez]], and [[Pramila Jayapal]]. Districts won ranged from D+13 to D+34 on the [[Cook Partisan Voting Index|Cook PVI]], meaning solid Democrat. No swing districts were won. ==History== After the 2016 presidential election resulted in a victory for [[Donald Trump]], many progressives pointed to the perceived loyalty of politicians to large donors as a major contributing factor to Clinton's loss to Trump. These critics contend that a campaign finance model more similar to that of [[Bernie Sanders]], whose 2016 presidential campaign was funded by small individual donations, will increase public trust in politicians and accountability to constituents. On January 23, 2017, Cenk Uygur and Kyle Kulinski founded Justice Democrats with ten others, including former staffers from the Sanders campaign such as its Director of Organizing Technology, Saikat Chakrabarti, and [[MoveOn.org]] fundraiser [[Zack Exley]].{{cite news |first1=David |last1= Weigel |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/post-politics/wp/2017/01/23/progressives-launch-justice-democrats-to-counter-primary-corporate-legislators/ |title=Progressives launch 'Justice Democrats' to counter party's 'corporate' legislators |newspaper=[[The Washington Post]] |date=January 23, 2017 }}{{cite web |author=Scott Hough |url=http://www.inquisitr.com/3914377/justice-democrats-cenk-uygur-the-young-turks-progressives-launch-party-takeover/ |title=Justice Democrats: Cenk Uygur, The Young Turks, Progressives Launch Party Takeover |website=[[Inquisitr]] |date=January 23, 2017}}{{Cite web|url=https://mic.com/articles/166390/cenk-ugyur-bernie-sanders-staffers-team-up-to-take-over-the-democratic-party#.GsQGoCrOw |title=Cenk Uygur, Bernie Sanders staffers team up to take over the Democratic Party |author=Tom McKay |date=January 23, 2017 |website=Mic.com |access-date=January 25, 2017 }} According to the organization, they seek to create a left-wing populist movement to support alternative Democratic candidates beginning with the 2018 mid-term elections, in order to either defeat the incumbent Democrats or cause them to become accountable to their constituents. They require their candidates to take a pledge to refuse financial contributions from billionaires and corporations. In addition, they hope to rebuild the Democratic Party on a national level and to defeat President Trump if he runs for re-election in 2020. {{quote|The Democrats used to represent something wonderful – voters. We want you to represent just us, not your donors.|Cenk Uygur, known for his affection of puns, explaining the name of the group{{cite web|url=http://www.realclearpolitics.com/video/2017/01/24/cenk_uygur_launches_a_new_wing_of_democratic_party_justice_democrats.html|title=Cenk Uygur Launches A "New Wing" Of Democratic Party: Justice Democrats|first1= Tim |last1=Haines |date= January 24, 2017|publisher=RealClearPolitics.com|work=[[The Young Turks]]|access-date=March 25, 2017}}|source=}} Justice Democrats announced in March 2017 they had teamed up with [[Brand New Congress]], a PAC established by former Sanders campaign supporters, to further their goals. As of March 20, 2017, Justice Democrats have reported they have received 8,300 nominations and raised $1 million.{{cite web |first1=Alex |last1=Seitz-Wald |url=http://www.nbcnews.com/storyline/democrats-vs-trump/democrats-beware-sanders-movement-turns-midterms-n735301/ |title=Democrats Beware: Sanders 'Movement' Turns to Midterms |website=[[NBCNews]] |date=March 20, 2017}} Representative [[Ro Khanna]] of [[California's 17th congressional district]] announced on May 9, 2017, that he had become a Justice Democrat, and the first sitting member of Congress to join the organization. On November 1, 2017, Justice Democrats announced on social media that fellow progressive group [[AllOfUs]] had merged with the group.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/justicedems/status/925751071687004161|title=Justice Democrats candidates|website=[[Twitter]]|language=en|date=1 November 2017}}{{cite web|title=Justice Democrats Merge With AllOfUs.org|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HNfmcL3-ZHE|website=YouTube|accessdate=2 November 2017|date=1 November 2017}} ===Uygur resignation=== On December 22, 2017, it was announced that Uygur had resigned from his position at the organization, following the revelation of previously deleted but archived controversial blog posts he had written when he was a Republican almost two decades earlier that were featured in a report by ''[[TheWrap]]'' that were reported to have been posted in the late 1990s and early 2000s. Uygur apologized the day prior and revealed that he deleted the "ugly" posts over a decade ago because he no longer stood by those principles.{{cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=389018184872261&id=243510442756370|title=Justice Democrats|website=[[Facebook]]|language=en|access-date=June 13, 2018}} The following day, Kulinski announced that he had stepped down from the organization as he disagreed with the opinions of the Justice Democrats staff members that pressed for Uygur's dismissal over the blog posts. He said his decision came as a result of a personal dilemma as he saw the posts in question upon re-reading them as being satirical due to them dealing with Uygur complaining about his inability to attract women. Kulinski noted that the decision to ask for Uygur's resignation came from the Justice Democrats staff, not the candidates, and as such he asked his supporters to continue backing the organization's candidates.{{cite web|last=Secular Talk|title=Statement On Cenk Uygur & Justice Democrats|date=December 23, 2017|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kczCNvJYlxk|website=[[YouTube]]|accessdate=June 13, 2018}} ==Ideology and political issues== According to Justice Democrats, their highest priority is to effectively eliminate the role of money and conflicts of interests in politics, and the group's only litmus test is that candidates decline to accept money from PACs. They wish to pass a constitutional amendment to "put an end to Washington corruption and bring about election reform". They support the idea of [[publicly funded elections]], banning Super PACs as well as banning private donations to politicians and campaigns. In addition, they advocate the reinstatement of provisions of the [[Voting Rights Act of 1965]] and a ban on [[gerrymandering]] for partisan gain. As a core policy, any candidate running with Justice Democrats must pledge to refuse any donations from billionaires or corporations. They plan to call a constitutional convention. In addition, their platform encourages many [[Progressivism|progressive]] priorities,[https://www.justicedemocrats.com/platform Platform]. Justice Democrats. Retrieved July 1, 2018. [https://www.justicedemocrats.com/issues Issues]. Justice Democrats. Retrieved July 19, 2018. such as: *Creating a new infrastructure program called the "New [[New Deal]]". *Discontinuing arms sales to countries that violate human rights such as Saudi Arabia and Egypt. *Enacting a federal jobs guarantee, which would promise all Americans a job paying $15 per hour plus benefits. *Ending the [[Capital punishment|death penalty]]. *Ending the practice of [[Bush Doctrine|unilaterally waging war]], except as a last resort to defend U.S. territory. *Ending the [[War on Drugs]] in favor of legalization, regulation, and taxation of drugs, and pardoning all non-violent drug offenders and treating all drug addicts. *Ensuring free speech on college campuses and supporting [[Net neutrality in the United States|net neutrality]]. *Ensuring [[universal education]] as a right, including free public college and university education. *Ensuring [[universal healthcare]] as a right. *Establishing paid maternity leave, paid vacation leave, and free childcare. *Expanding anti-discrimination laws to apply to homosexual and transgender people. *Expanding background checks on firearms and banning high capacity magazines and assault weapons. *Funding [[Planned Parenthood]] and other contraceptive and abortion services, and recognizing reproductive rights. *Implementing [[electoral reform]] and [[Publicly funded elections|publicly financed elections]] nationwide to make irrelevant and obsolete fundraising from large corporations and the wealthy. *Implementing [[instant-runoff voting]] nationwide in an effort to make [[Third party (United States)|third-party]] and [[Independent politician|independent]] candidates more viable. *Implementing the [[Buffett Rule]], ending [[offshore financial centre|offshore financial centers]], "chain[ing]" the capital gains and income taxes, and increasing the estate tax. *Making the minimum wage a [[living wage]] and tying it to inflation. *Pardoning [[Edward Snowden]], prosecuting CIA torturers and DoD war criminals, shutting down the [[Guantanamo Bay detention camp]] and all other extrajudicial prisons, and ending warrantless spying and bulk data collection by the [[National Security Agency]]. *Passing the [[Paycheck Fairness Act]]. *Abolishing [[U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement|ICE]]. *Reforming police by mandating body cameras, establishing community oversight boards, eliminating [[broken windows theory|broken windows policing]], ending stop and frisk, and appointing special prosecutors to hold police accountable in courts. *Renegotiating other free trade deals [[Dominican Republic–Central America Free Trade Agreement|CAFTA-DR]], and [[North American Free Trade Agreement|NAFTA]] and opposing the [[Permanent Normal Trade Relations]] with China and the [[World Trade Organization]]. *Stopping any reductions to [[Social Security (United States)|Social Security]], [[Medicare (United States)|Medicare]], and [[Medicaid]], and establishing [[Single-payer healthcare|single-payer universal healthcare]]. *Stopping [[climate change]] through [[Green New Deal|an ecological revolution]] and upholding the United States' participation in the [[Paris Climate Agreement]]. *Uncompromisingly rejecting President Trump's [[Immigration policy of Donald Trump|immigration proposals and policies]], particularly the [[Executive Order 13769]] and deportation of illegal immigrants, and implementing comprehensive immigration reform which will give non-criminal illegal immigrants a path to citizenship. == Political activity == As of August 22, 2018, there are |[[United States House of Representatives elections in Washington, 2018#District 7|2018-08-07]] |{{Yes|Won}}||{{Yes|82.7%}} |{{Yes|Won}} |{{Yes|83.4%}} |- style="text-align:center;" 9|2018-08-07]] |{{Yes|Advanced}} |{{Yes|26.9%}} |{{No|Lost}} |{{No|TBD}} |- style="text-align:center;" |{{sortname|Randy|Bryce}} |Wisconsin |[[Wisconsin's 1st congressional district]] |[[United States House of Representatives elections in Wisconsin, 2018#District 1|2018-08-14]] |{{Yes|Won}} |{{Yes|59.6%}} |{{No|Lost}} |{{No|42.3%}} |} === Summer for Progress === Several progressive organizations, including [[Our Revolution]], [[Democratic Socialists of America]], [[National Nurses United]], [[Working Families Party]], and [[Brand New Congress]], announced in July 2017 a push to encourage House Democrats to sign on to a #PeoplesPlatform, which consists of supporting "eight bills currently in the House of Representatives that will address the concerns of everyday Americans."{{cite web |title=Summer for Progress Petition |url=https://actionnetwork.org/petitions/s4p |accessdate=23 July 2017}} These eight bills and the topics they address are: #Medicare for All: H.R. 676, the Medicare For All Act{{cite web |url=https://www.govtrack.us/congress/bills/115/hr676 |title=H.R. 676 (115th) |accessdate=July 23, 2017 |author=115th Congress (2017) |date=January 24, 2017 |work=Legislation |publisher=GovTrack.us |quote=Expanded & Improved Medicare For All Act}} #Free College Tuition: H.R. 1880, the College for All Act of 2017{{cite web |url=https://www.govtrack.us/congress/bills/115/hr1880 |title=H.R. 1880 (115th) |accessdate=July 23, 2017 |author=115th Congress (2017) |date=April 4, 2017 |work=Legislation |publisher=GovTrack.us |quote=College for All Act of 2017}} #Worker Rights: H.R. 15, the Raise the Wage Act{{cite web |url=https://www.govtrack.us/congress/bills/115/hr15 |title=H.R. 15 (115th) |accessdate=July 23, 2017 |author=115th Congress (2017) |date=May 25, 2017 |work=Legislation |publisher=GovTrack.us |quote=Raise the Wage Act}} #Women’s Rights: H.R. 771, the Equal Access to Abortion Coverage in Health Insurance (EACH Woman) Act of 2017{{cite web |url=https://www.govtrack.us/congress/bills/115/hr771 |title=H.R. 771 (115th) |accessdate=July 23, 2017 |author=115th Congress (2017) |date=January 31, 2017 |work=Legislation |publisher=GovTrack.us |quote=Equal Access to Abortion Coverage in Health Insurance (EACH Woman) Act of 2017}} #Voting Rights: H.R. 2840, the Automatic Voter Registration Act{{cite web |url=https://www.govtrack.us/congress/bills/115/hr2840 |title=H.R. 2840 (115th) |accessdate=July 23, 2017 |author=115th Congress (2017) |date=June 8, 2017 |work=Legislation |publisher=GovTrack.us |quote=Automatic Voter Registration Act}} #Environmental Justice: H.R. 4114, the Environmental Justice Act of 2017{{cite web |title=H.R.4114 - Environmental Justice Act of 2017 |url=https://www.congress.gov/bill/115th-congress/house-bill/4114/text |website=Congress.gov |accessdate=December 8, 2017}} #Criminal Justice and Immigrant Rights: H.R. 3227, the Justice Is Not for Sale Act of 2017{{cite web |url=https://www.govtrack.us/congress/bills/115/hr3227 |title=H.R. 3227 (115th) |accessdate=July 23, 2017 |author=115th Congress (2017) |date=July 13, 2017 |work=Legislation |publisher=GovTrack.us |quote=To improve Federal sentencing and corrections practices, and for other purposes.}} #Taxing Wall Street: H.R. 1144, the Inclusive Prosperity Act{{cite web |url=https://www.govtrack.us/congress/bills/115/hr1144 |title=H.R. 1144 (115th) |accessdate=July 23, 2017 |author=115th Congress (2017) |date=February 16, 2017 |work=Legislation |publisher=GovTrack.us |quote=Inclusive Prosperity Act of 2017}} === Congressional members of the Justice Democrats === [[Ro Khanna]] of [[California's 17th congressional district]] announced on May 9, 2017 that he is a member of Justice Democrats and supports the organization's agenda.{{cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/politics/essential/la-pol-ca-essential-politics-updates-rep-ro-khanna-joins-progressive-group-1494621068-htmlstory.html|title=California politics updates: Gov. Brown's adds cash to budget; McClintock calls for independent prosecutor for Russia investigation|publisher=Los Angeles Times|first1=Sarah|last1=Wire|date= May 12, 2017|quote=Khanna's decision to join Justice Democrats, along with his pledge not to take PAC or lobbyist money, are unexpected establishment-flouting moves for a man who just started his political career and hopes for a long term role in the party.}} On December 6, 2017, Justice Democrats announced that [[Raul Grijalva]] of [[Arizona's 3rd congressional district]] had joined the group.{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/justicedems/status/938550633136828416|title=BIG NEWS: Progressive populist @RepRaulGrijalva is joining the Justice Democrats! Grijalva has a career fighting for working families, immigrant rights, and taking on the billionaires who want to divide us. Unity!|last1=Justice|first1=Democrats|date=December 6, 2017|website=Twitter|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=December 6, 2017}} Justice Democrats pushed for [[Keith Ellison]] of [[Minnesota's 5th congressional district]] to run for the Senate seat once occupied by Senator [[Al Franken]]. Ellison declined to run for the Senate seat.{{cite news|url=http://www.startribune.com/rep-keith-ellison-won-t-run-for-u-s-senate-in-18/463913693/|title=Rep. Keith Ellison won't run for U.S. Senate in '18|work=[[Star Tribune]]|last1=Coolican|first1=J. Patrick|date=December 13, 2017|accessdate=December 13, 2017}} Ellison, [[Deputy Chair of the Democratic National Committee]], has not announced whether or not he supports Justice Democrats, and has left Congressional politics, running for, and winning, the 2018 Minnesota Attorney General election. On April 16, 2018, Justice Democrats announced that [[Pramila Jayapal]] of [[Washington's 7th congressional district]] had joined the group.{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/justicedems/status/985943292301934592|title=We are excited to announce today, one of Congress’ most fearless progressive has joined our Justice Democrats family. Please welcome @RepJayapal – a champion for women of color, immigration rights, and racial and economic justice.|last1=Justice|first1=Democrats|date=April 16, 2018|website=Twitter|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=April 16, 2018}} === Notes === {{reflist |group=n}} == See also == *[[Our Revolution]] *[[Brand New Congress]] *[[Wolf PAC]] == References == {{reflist|27em}} == External links == *{{Official website|https://justicedemocrats.com/}} *[https://www.fec.gov/data/committee/C00630665/?tab=summary Justice Democrats financial reports] from the [[Federal Election Commission]] {{Ideological caucuses in the U.S. Congress}} {{TYT Network}} [[Category:2017 establishments in California]] [[Category:2017 in American politics]] [[Category:Aftermath of the United States presidential election, 2016]] [[Category:Anti-corporate activism]] [[Category:Bernie Sanders presidential campaign, 2016]] [[Category:Democratic Party (United States) organizations]] [[Category:Left-wing populism in the United States]] [[Category:Organizations based in Los Angeles]] [[Category:Progressive organizations in the United States]] [[Category:The Young Turks (talk show)]] [[Category:United States political action committees]]

{{peacock|date=December 2017}} {{EngvarB|date=October 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2014}} {{Infobox artist | name = Kid Chan | image = Kid Chan Photographer.jpg | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1978|1|15}}<ref name=FB>{{cite web|title=Kid Chan – Official Facebook page|url=http://www.facebook.com/iamkidchan?sk=info|work=Facebook|accessdate=4 January 2012}}</ref> | birth_place = [[Kuala Lumpur]], Malaysia | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = Malaysian | field = Photography | training = | movement = | works = ''Kid Chan's Guide to the Business of Photography'' | patrons = | influenced = | awards = | signature = | module = {{Infobox Chinese|child=yes|hide=no | s = 陈文杰<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.orientaldaily.com.my/s/123977|script-title=zh:陈文杰摄影厚相簿|newspaper=[[Oriental Daily News (Malaysia)]]|date=25 January 2016|access-date=7 December 2017}}</ref> | t = 陳文傑 | p = Chén Wénjié | y = Chàhn Màhn-giht | j = Chan4 Man4git6}} }}
'''Kid Chan''' (born 15 January 1978 in [[Kuala Lumpur]]) is an international [[wedding photojournalist]],<ref name=TKGU>{{cite news|last=Khoo|first=Rubin|title=The kid grows up|url=http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2008/1/20/yummy/20080119111950&sec=yummy|accessdate=3 January 2012|newspaper=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]|date=20 January 2008 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131206032429/http://www.thestar.com.my/story.aspx?file=%2f2008%2f1%2f20%2fyummy%2f20080119111950&sec=yummy |archive-date=6 December 2013}}</ref> [[portrait photography|portrait]] and [[Celebrity photography|celebrity photographer]] from [[Malaysia]].<ref name=watches>{{cite news|title=Fashionable watches for the young|url=http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2008/5/10/central/21166473&sec=central|archive-url=https://archive.is/20130221032128/http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2008/5/10/central/21166473&sec=central|dead-url=yes|archive-date=21 February 2013|accessdate=4 January 2012|newspaper=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]|date=10 May 2008}}</ref><ref name=KOSMO>{{cite news|last=Periaswamy|first=Nizha|title=Bermain dengan imej dan persepsi|url=http://www.kosmo.com.my/kosmo/content.asp?y=2011&dt=0228&pub=Kosmo&sec=Rencana_Utama&pg=ru_01.htm|accessdate=4 January 2012|newspaper=[[Kosmo!]]}}</ref> He was the first Malaysian to be accepted as a member of the [[Wedding photojournalist#Organizations|Wedding Photojournalist Association]] (WPJA), and was named by ''[[Tatler|Malaysian Tatler]]'' as "one of the 100 people you must know in Asia". Chan is often credited as a pioneer in [[Wedding customs by country#Malay wedding customs|Malay wedding]] photojournalism.<ref name=persona>{{cite web|last=Rajem|first=Radzha|title=Kid Chan perintis wedding photojournalism|url=http://kidchan.fotopages.com/?entry=958674|work=Persona Pengantin|publisher=Persona Pengantin|accessdate=7 January 2012}}</ref> Notable high profile personalities photographed by Chan include [[Malay titles#Tan Sri|Tan Sri]] Dr [[Zeti Akhtar Aziz]], governor of [[Bank Negara Malaysia]]; [[Cherie Blair]], wife of former British Prime Minister [[Tony Blair]]; actor [[Jackie Chan]]; business tycoon Tan Sri Dr. [[Francis Yeoh]]; model [[Elle Macpherson]]; and designer [[Jimmy Choo]]. The media often refers to him as "one of Malaysia's most sought-after wedding photographers". In 2013, he published his first book, ''Kid Chan's Guide to the Business of Photography'' in 2013, which went to number one in the Malaysian best-sellers list.
==Life and career== Raised in [[Kuala Lumpur]], the capital of Malaysia, Chan attended the Sri Cempaka school before pursuing a degree in international business from [[Curtin University of Technology]] in Perth, Australia.<ref name=KOSMO/> He began his working life in the corporate world before taking up photography. After two years as an executive assistant in the corporate sector, Chan became burnt out and decided to take up an [[apprenticeship]] at a photography studio<ref name=options /> under the mentorship of TS Lim of Studio 88.<ref name=pmoney>{{cite journal|last=Tan|first=Celine|title=Never Give Up|journal=Personal Money|date=September 2011|pages=54–56|publisher=The Edge|location=Malaysia}}</ref>
[[File:Kid Chan and Mahatir.jpg|thumb|left|Chan with [[Mahathir Mohamad|Tun Dr. Mahathir Mohamad]], former Prime Minister of Malaysia]] In 2000, through a [[management buyout]], he took over a company called Portrait One. The company was later rebranded as Kid Chan Studio.<ref name=options>{{cite journal|last=Toyad|first=Jacqueline|title=Picture perfect|journal=Options|date=29 May 2005|pages=10}}</ref>
Originally focused on corporate photography, along the way, Chan agreed to take photographs of his clients' children's weddings.<ref name=TKGU/> He has since photographed many high profile royalty, politicians, artists and celebrities.<ref name=KOSMO/>
Chan has photographed numerous celebrities, including being the exclusive photographer for the weddings of television personality [[Paula Malai Ali]] and Tengku Kudin, and songstress [[Siti Nurhaliza]] and Khalid Jiwa.<ref name=TKGU/> He was also the official photographer for the royal wedding of [[Jaafar of Negeri Sembilan|Tengku Aslahuddin Jaa'far]] and Sofia Erica Lane, and these photos were used in an exclusive cover story in ''[[Harper's Bazaar]]''.<ref name=hb /> Other notable high profile personalities he has photographed include [[Malay titles#Tan Sri|Tan Sri]] Dr [[Zeti Akhtar Aziz]], governor of [[Bank Negara Malaysia]]; [[Cherie Blair]], wife of former British Prime Minister [[Tony Blair]]; and actor [[Jackie Chan]].<ref name=pmoney /> Chan was commissioned to take the cover shot of ''Millionaireasia'', which featured business tycoon [[Malay styles and titles#Tan Sri|Tan Sri]] Dr. [[Francis Yeoh]].<ref name=millioncover>{{cite web|title=Cover shot of Francis Yeoh for Millionaireasia |url=http://www.kidchan.com/2011/07/cover-shot-of-tan-sri-francis-yeoh-for-millionairasia/ |publisher=Kid Chan |accessdate=7 January 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111108191354/http://www.kidchan.com/2011/07/cover-shot-of-tan-sri-francis-yeoh-for-millionairasia/ |archivedate= 8 November 2011 |df= }}</ref> Other celebrities photographed by Chan include [[Elle Macpherson]] and [[Jimmy Choo]].<ref name=kcblog>{{cite web|title=Britain's Next Top Model Cycle 6 |url=http://www.kidchan.com/2010/09/britains-next-top-model-cycle-6/ |publisher=Kid Chan |accessdate=4 January 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111107100057/http://www.kidchan.com/2010/09/britains-next-top-model-cycle-6/ |archivedate= 7 November 2011 |df= }}</ref>
In a photography competition organised by the [[History (U.S. TV channel)|History Channel]] in 2009, the grand prize offered was a photography session worth [[MYR|RM]]10,000 with Chan.<ref name=histcomp>{{cite news|last=Koay|first=Allan|title=Snapshots for eternity|url=http://thestar.com.my/lifestyle/story.asp?file=/2009/3/2/lifefocus/3336876&sec=lifefocus|archive-url=https://archive.is/20130219043356/http://thestar.com.my/lifestyle/story.asp?file=/2009/3/2/lifefocus/3336876&sec=lifefocus|dead-url=yes|archive-date=19 February 2013|accessdate=4 January 2012|newspaper=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]|date=2 March 2009}}</ref> In 2010, his collection of images of three cancer survivors and their families were exhibited in 50 [[Courts Malaysia]]'s stores nationwide, as part of an exhibition to raise funds for the National Cancer Society of Malaysia (NCSM) through its "Hope for Our Children" campaign.<ref name=NCSM>{{cite news|last=Low|first=Christina|title=Educate children on healthy lifestyle|url=http://thestar.com.my/metro/story.asp?file=/2010/8/16/central/6835826&sec=central|archive-url=https://archive.is/20130221063025/http://thestar.com.my/metro/story.asp?file=/2010/8/16/central/6835826&sec=central|dead-url=yes|archive-date=21 February 2013|accessdate=4 January 2012|newspaper=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]|date=16 August 2010}}</ref> In the same year, he was invited to photographically document the shooting of [[Britain's Next Top Model, Cycle 6#Episode 11|Britain's Next Top Model Cycle 6]] in episode 11, which was filmed in Kuala Lumpur.<ref name=kcblog /> In 2011, Chan was invited to be a judge for the Malaysia's Online Fashion Entrepreneurs' Weekend (MOFEW), together with [[Amber Chia]].<ref name=mofew>{{cite web|title=MOFEW |url=http://mofew.com.my/thesearch/?page_id=132 |work=MOFEW |accessdate=4 January 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120426093122/http://mofew.com.my/thesearch/?page_id=132 |archivedate=26 April 2012 |df= }}</ref> In 2012, he was appointed ambassador for MenCare.<ref name=mencare-star>{{cite news|title=Company launches MenCare to educate men on breast cancer|url=http://www.thestar.com.my/story.aspx?file=%2f2012%2f11%2f6%2fcentral%2f12247590&sec=central|accessdate=15 July 2013|newspaper=The Star|date=6 November 2012}}</ref> Supported by [[GE]], MenCare is an initiative by [[Pfizer|Pfizer Malaysia]] and the National Council of Women's Organisations (NCWO) Malaysia. It aims to educate men on breast cancer and how it affects families as well as to gather men's support for breastcare health of their spouses and female members of their families.<ref name=mc-nst>{{cite news|title=Men urged to join breast cancer fight|url=http://www.nst.com.my/nation/general/men-urged-to-join-breast-cancer-fight-1.161490|accessdate=15 July 2013|newspaper=New Straits Times|date=25 October 2012}}</ref>
Chan is married to Shirlyn Lim, a [[chartered accountant]],<ref name=prestige /> and they have two daughters Faith and Adira, and a son Joshua.<ref name=prestige /><ref name=KOSMO/><ref name=pmoney />
==Book== [[File:Kidchan book.jpg|thumb|Chan at the launch of ''Kid Chan's Guide to the Business of Photography'' at [[Sunway University]]]]Chan published his first book, ''Kid Chan's Guide to the Business of Photography'' in 2013. The book contains 11 chapters, and covers topics that deal with setting up a photography business. It is the first photography business book written from a Malaysian perspective. The book is part of the "MPH Masterclass Series" from publisher [[MPH Group|MPH]], which is a collection of books by experts who want to share their experiences.<ref name=sun-book>{{cite news|last=Jacob|first=Anansa|title=Life behind the lens|url=http://www.thesundaily.my/news/753743|accessdate=17 July 2013|newspaper=The Sun|date=26 June 2013}}</ref>
The book shot up to the number one position on the MPH best-sellers list in the non-fiction category for the week ending 16 June 2013.<ref name=star-bestsellers>{{cite news|title=Bestsellers|url=http://www.thestar.com.my/story.aspx?file=%2f2013%2f6%2f23%2flifebookshelf%2f13270307&sec=lifebookshelf|accessdate=17 July 2013|newspaper=The Star|date=23 June 2013}}</ref> It remained on the best-seller list and was the number one selling book for the month of June 2013.<ref name=star-bestseller_june13>{{cite news|title=Bestsellers|url=http://www.thestar.com.my/story.aspx?file=%2f2013%2f6%2f30%2flifebookshelf%2f13283278&sec=lifebookshelf|accessdate=24 July 2013|newspaper=The Star|date=30 June 2013}}</ref>
==Accolades== [[File:Kid Chan National Cancer Society.jpg|thumb|Chan presenting an image to a cancer survivor and his family in support of the "Hope for the Children" campaign for the National Cancer Society of Malaysia]] Chan was the first Malaysian to be accepted as a member of the US based [[Wedding photojournalist#Organizations|Wedding Photojournalist Association]] (WPJA),<ref name=TKGU/> and was named by Malaysian ''[[Tatler]]''[[Tatler| ]]<nowiki/>as "one of the 100 people you must know in Asia" in 2006.<ref name=TKGU/><ref name=tatler>{{cite journal|title=100 People You Must Know in Asia|journal=Tatler Asia|date=September 2006|pages=193}}</ref> In the same year, ''Le Prestige'' magazine named him in their "Top 40 under 40" list.<ref name=prestige>{{cite journal|title=Top 40 Under 40|journal=Le Prestige|date=September 2006|pages=29}}</ref> Chan is often credited as a pioneer in Malay wedding photojournalism.<ref name=persona/> The media often refers to him as "one of Malaysia's most sought-after wedding photographers".<ref name=NST-kid>{{cite news|last=Kaur|first=Manveet|title=Chan loves weddings, no kid-ding|url=http://www.kidchan.com/wp-content/uploads/2005/05/Nst.pdf|accessdate=11 January 2012|newspaper=New Straits Times|date=15 May 2005}}</ref><ref name=dreamwed>{{cite news|title=A weekend to plan your dream wedding|url=http://thestar.com.my/metro/story.asp?file=/2008/8/1/central/1686987&sec=central|archive-url=https://archive.is/20130221024409/http://thestar.com.my/metro/story.asp?file=/2008/8/1/central/1686987&sec=central|dead-url=yes|archive-date=21 February 2013|accessdate=4 January 2012|newspaper=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]|date=1 August 2008}}</ref>
In 2008, ''Tiger Tales'', the official magazine of [[Tiger Airways]], named him in their "annual list of trail-blazers across Asia and Australia".<ref name=tiger>{{cite web|last=Siow|first=Sean|title=Wedding Photographer to the Stars|url=http://www.tigertales.sg/features/2008/09/cover-story-beauty-and-the-feast|work=Tiger tales|publisher=Tiger Airways|accessdate=4 January 2012}}</ref> In the same year, he was named as one of Malaysia's most influential youth entrepreneurs under 30 by Youth Entrepreneur.<ref>{{cite journal|journal=Youth Entrepreneur|title=youth Entrepreneur|year=2008|url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/iamkidchan/6640776455/sizes/l/in/photostream/|accessdate=6 January 2012}}</ref> In 2011, ''Glam'', Malaysia premier lifestyle luxury magazine, listed Chan as the only photographer in their top choice for luxury wedding vendors, citing in-depth knowledge of Malay wedding culture and protocol.<ref name=glam>{{cite web|title=5 Direktori Perkahwinan |url=http://www.glam.com.my/2011/11/01/13-direktori-perkahwinan/ |work=Glam |publisher=Blu Inc |accessdate=7 January 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111127020314/http://www.glam.com.my/2011/11/01/13-direktori-perkahwinan/ |archivedate=27 November 2011 |df= }}</ref> In 2012, he was the only Asian photographer to be listed in [[Condé Nast Publications|Conde Nast]]'s [[Brides (magazine)|Brides UK]]'s "Top 20 Extremely Talented Destination Wedding Photographers in the World" feature.<ref name=condenast>{{cite web|last=Ho |first=mabel |title=Kid Chan Studio Among World's Best |url=http://www.weddingguideasia.com/wed/kid-chan-studio-among-worlds-best/ |publisher=Wedding Guide Asia |accessdate=15 July 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140819082705/http://www.weddingguideasia.com/wed/kid-chan-studio-among-worlds-best/ |archivedate=19 August 2014 |df= }}</ref>
Chan has received numerous accolades from the media, and has been featured in ''[[Harper's Bazaar]]'',<ref name=hb>{{cite web|title=Royal Wedding of HH Tengku Aslahuddin Ja'afar & Sofia Erica Lane as featured in Harper's Bazaar |url=http://www.kidchan.com/2011/02/royal-wedding-of-hrh-tengku-aslahuddin-jaafar-sofia-erica-lane-as-featured-on-harpers-bazaar-life/ |work=kcwebsite |accessdate=7 January 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120109174938/http://www.kidchan.com/2011/02/royal-wedding-of-hrh-tengku-aslahuddin-jaafar-sofia-erica-lane-as-featured-on-harpers-bazaar-life/ |archivedate= 9 January 2012 |df= }}</ref> ''[[The Edge (Malaysia)|The Edge]]'', the ''[[New Straits Times]]'', ''Persona Pengantin'', ''[[Harian Metro]]'', and ''[[Prestige Hong Kong|Prestige]]'' magazine.<ref name=pmoney /> Chan was also featured in the inaugural Malaysia edition of ''August Man'' magazine.<ref name=augman>{{cite magazine |title=August DNA- 7 individuals who best represent the qualities of August Man |magazine=[[August Man]] |date=September 2006 |volume=1 |issue=1 |pages=74}}</ref>
==Speaking engagements== Chan has been invited as a motivational and photography speaker at numerous conferences and workshops. In 2009, he was invited as a guest speaker for the 1Malaysia Entrepreneurship Month, which was organised by [[Sunway Group#Notable subsidiaries|Sunway University College]] in collaboration with the Higher Education Ministry.<ref name=sunway>{{cite news|title=Kindling the business spirit|url=http://thestar.com.my/education/story.asp?file=/2009/9/20/education/4669457&sec=education|accessdate=4 January 2012|newspaper=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]|date=20 September 2009}}</ref> In 2010, together with award-winning director [[Yasmin Ahmad]], Chan was invited as a speaker at [[TED (conference)#Programs|TEDxKualaLumpur]].<ref name=TED>{{cite web|last=CerVentus|first=Daniel|title=TEDxKualaLumpur Speakers and Schedules|url=http://www.entrepreneurs.my/tedxkualalumpur-speakers-and-schedules/|work=entrepreneurs.my|publisher=entrepreneurs.my|accessdate=4 January 2012}}</ref>
